bullets.text: SpaceX hits $800 billion valuation preparing IPO, cementing dominance in launch and satellite markets and repricing private space assets.
White House expected to reclassify cannabis soon; sector rallies on shift from Schedule I toward leniency, potentially unlocking banking, research, and tax relief.
Trump floats Kevin Warsh for Fed chair and asserts presidential say on rates, while Goolsbee warns against front‑loading cuts, injecting policy uncertainty.
AI trade wobbles: Broadcom sinks despite strong results as “AI angst” hits chip and software peers, though Oracle denies OpenAI deal delays.
Hyperscaler capex projected to triple by 2026, signaling prolonged infrastructure supercycle across data centers, power, cooling, and networking suppliers.
Texas faces a flood of AI data center proposals, raising bubble concerns and highlighting power‑grid and water‑supply constraints.
White House moves to preempt state AI rules with a single federal framework, but legal challenges threaten uncertainty for startups and compliance planning.
Microsoft commits to 3.6 million metric tons of carbon removal from bioenergy with CCS, scaling demand for negative‑emissions projects and long‑term offtake financing.
Falling home prices are eroding homeowner equity, reversing pandemic gains and pressuring consumer balance sheets and mobility.
Coinbase to launch regulated prediction markets via Kalshi integration, expanding crypto’s financial utility and fee streams amid evolving derivatives oversight.
TSA sharing passenger data with ICE to accelerate deportations, while DOT threatens funding cuts over noncitizen licenses, intensifying federal‑state immigration clashes.
Russia’s war financing remains robust for years, raising escalation risk and testing U.S. resolve under Trump amid aid fatigue.
Risk‑based breast cancer screening performs as well as annual checks after 40, suggesting cost‑effective personalization of imaging schedules.
Retailers race to deploy AI shopping tools projected to influence $263 billion in holiday sales, reshaping marketing spend and conversion economics.
700Credit breach affects at least 5.6 million consumers, exposing auto‑finance data and underscoring third‑party cybersecurity risks for lenders and dealerships.
